title: Grilled Corn with Sambal-Sesame Butter
ingredients: ½cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature
directions: 1. Heat a 12-inch cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until very hot, about 4 minutes.

2. Prep and char the corn:- Shuck 4 ears of corn, discarding husks and corn silk.- Using tongs, arrange corn in the skillet and cook, rotating every 4 to 5 minutes, until kernels are sporadically charred, 15 to 20 minutes total. Set aside.

3. Make the sambal-sesame butter:- Mash together ½ cup room-temperature butter, ¼ cup sambal oelek, and 1 teaspoon sesame oil in a medium bowl until combined.- Finely grate the zest of 1 lime into the butter and stir to incorporate. Cut the lime into 4 wedges for serving.

4. Serve:- Optionally, cut each ear of corn in half crosswise.- Slather each ear with sambal-sesame butter while still warm, and season with flaky sea salt.- Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and serve with lime wedges and extra sambal-sesame butter.
